Name: loudoun_2008_address
Originator: Loudoun County, Virginia, Office of Mapping and Geographic Information (OMAGI)
OriginatorSort: Loudoun County, Virginia, Office of Mapping and Geographic Information (OMAGI)
Abstract: Address points mark the location of each addressable structure and its access point. The access point is the place where a driveway intersects the road. The building point is where the structure is located.  An addressable structure is one where people live, work, or gather.
FgdcText:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<metadata>
  <idinfo>
    <citation>
      <citeinfo>
        <origin>Loudoun County, Virginia, Office of Mapping and Geographic Information (OMAGI)</origin>
        <pubdate>2008</pubdate>
        <title>Addresses, Loudoun County, VA.</title>
        <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>
        <onlink>http://www.loudoun.gov/</onlink>
      <ftname Sync="TRUE">loudoun_2008_address</ftname>
</citeinfo>
    </citation>
    <descript>
      <abstract>Address points mark the location of each addressable structure and its access point. The access point is the place where a driveway intersects the road. The building point is where the structure is located.  An addressable structure is one where people live, work, or gather.</abstract>
      <purpose>The access point is used to assign an address to the structure.  Addresses are assigned to assist in the provision of emergency services; they can be queried at all Fire and Rescue stations and by E-911 dispatchers</purpose>
      <supplinf>Data are stored in the corporate ArcSDE Geodatabase as a point feature class.  The coordinate system is Virginia State Plane (North), Zone 4501, datum NAD83 HARN.</supplinf>
    </descript>

        </rngdates>

    </timeperd>

    </status>

  <dataqual>
    <attracc>
      <attraccr>Retention of attribute accuracy throughout the coverage to geodatabase feature class conversion process was ensured by a QA/QC programmatic check.  To meet satisfactory QA/QC requirements the input coverage and output feature class must have, on a record by record basis, identical attribution when comparing all concatenated fields to all the user-defined attribution.</attraccr>
    </attracc>
    <logic>Topologically Clean</logic>
    <complete>Features may have been eliminated or generalized due to scale and intended use.  To assist Loudoun County, Virginia in the maintenance of the data, please provide any information concerning discovered errors, omissions, or other discrepancies found in the data.</complete>
    <posacc>
      <horizpa>
        <horizpar>Currently the addresses are being moved within the building footprints.  It is an ongoing project and the accuracy cannot be determined at this time.

Retention of coordinate accuracy throughout the coverage to geodatabase feature class conversion process was ensured by a QA/QC programmatic check.  To meet satisfactory QA/QC requirements the input coverage and output feature class must have the same record total, and on a record by record basis, area, perimeter and length differential of less than +/- 0.5%.</horizpar>
      </horizpa>
      <vertacc>
        <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.</vertaccr>
      </vertacc>
    </posacc>

      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Address layer created to assign and maintain addresses for new development and commercial properties.</procdesc>
        <procdate>1987</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>Address Coordinator</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>The rural route and box addresses were not being maintained at the time by the County.  In 1990, the rural readdressing program was initiated by the Board of Supervisors in order to name all roads in the county and to assign addresses to all rural routes.  The process to create an addressing ordinance was also initiated at this time.  The addressing ordinance was passed 1/21/92.</procdesc>
        <procdate>1/21/92</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>Addressing Coordinator</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>This data set was part of a batch process that converted legacy data from ArcInfo coverage in Librarian to a single-tiled ArcInfo coverage in preparation for a final conversion to ArcSDE Geodatabase Feature Classes.  Data were extracted from Librarian using the EXTRACT TOPOLOGICAL command.
        Multi-tiled data sets were extracted into multiple coverages and then combined based on the feature type(s).  Layers with both polygon and arc feature classes were processed with the Arc commands MAPJOIN and DISSOLVE.  Arc feature classes alone were processed with the Arc commands, APPEND and DISSOLVE.  Layers with both arc and point feature classes and point feature classes alone were processed with the Arc command, APPEND.  When used, the arc command, DISSOLVE, was given with the <#all> option.
        All coverages were then reprojected to HARN83 using the following .prj file specifications:
        INPUT
        PROJECTION STATEPLANE
        UNITS FEET
        ZONE 5551
        DATUM NAD27 NADCON
        PARAMETERS
        OUTPUT
        PROJECTION STATEPLANE
        UNITS FEET
        FIPSZONE 4501
        DATUM HPGN NADCON
        PARAMETERS END

        The dataset was then converted to a feature class in a geodatabase in ArcSDE.</procdesc>
        <procdate>2004</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Current process:
Rural addresses are assigned at the time that a landowner builds a house.  The address is applied for and a map with the house and driveway location is provided.  Land development addresses are assigned to lots less than three acres when a record plat is recorded.  Commercial and multi-family residential addresses are assigned at the time of site plan approval.  An address is based on where the driveway or main access to a commercial/multi-family structure meets the road.</procdesc>
        <procdate>current</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>Addressing Coordinator</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Address points participate in an SDE Feature Data Set Topology with Parcel Polygons.
The rule, "Address Point must be properly inside Parcel Polygon" is validated daily.</procdesc>
        <procdate>current</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>Addressing Coordinator</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Dataset copied from the CD obtained from Loudoun County, VA.</procdesc>
        <srcused>\\GIS-VISITOR\C$\Documents and Settings\VISITOR\Desktop\GeorgeMason\pgdb_SDE_5211.mdb</srcused>
        <procdate/>
      </procstep>
    </lineage>

      <fees>Loudoun County distributes spatial data in ArcGIS coverage or shapefile format for the cost of reproduction. Countywide spatial datasets may be purchased for $21 per CD or $22 per DVD for up to 650 MB or 4.5 GB of data, respectively. There is a $10 surcharge to purchase countywide topography, and a $3 charge if the item is to be mailed. If the customer wants the data in DXF format and/or would like OMAGI to custom select specific geographic areas of the County, there is an additional $7 per 15 minute increment labor charge.  Select aerial imagery is also available.</fees>
    </stdorder>
